content.description: The Stage is a pretty fun, strenuous, and dynamic climb.Using the detached block for feet on the bottom may drop the grade down a few numbers.
content.location: Start sitting with two micro crimps down the right side of the boulder. Pull off somehow, throw for a good crimp, then jump to the lip, and top out.

content.description: The climb traverses the face from the middle to the far right. The crux is the middle of the traverse. There are a lot of tricky slopers.
content.location: This starts in the middle of the boulder on to adjacent edges (same start as Centerpiece and Hunt the Dynosaur). Go along a rail up right to a crimp, match it, and go to another crimp. Make two powerful moves so both hands are on the sloping lip. Traverse right to the end of the boulder, and top out (the same top out as Goblin Balloon Brigade).

content.description: Hunt the Dynosaur has super fun, crimpy climbing until an epic, massive dyno to a perfect ledge. This route skips the black jug flake directly above the edge you dyno off, (if the black jug flake is used, it would be a different route which is V0+). There are many awesome variations to the dyno, depending on where you start.
content.location: Sit start in the middle of the face on light colored edges (the same start as Centerpiece). Make a big move up and left to a good sidepull, and then move left on okay edges into the steepest part of the overhang. Plant some good feet, match the black edge, and do a massive dyno to the lighter colored ledge above.

content.description: This is a super fun, powerful problem. The crux is probably pulling off the ground and making a big move to a left hand crimp.
content.location: This climb is on the the very right end of the cliff. Start with both of your hands on sidepulls lower down, make a hard move to a left crimp (the crux), then use a combination of left hand crimps and slapping up a sidepull rail to get to the top. Use some slots for the topout.

content.description: This is the same as Hunt the Dynosaur, but you can use the black jug/flake.
content.location: Sit start in the middle of the face on light colored edges (the same start as Centerpiece and Hunt the Dynosaur). Make a big move up and left to a good sidepull, and then move left on okay crimps into the steepest part of the overhang. Then go up on good flakes and ledges to the top.

content.description: This is a relatively easy boulder problem. There is no obvious crux. It's just a fun and easy climb.
content.location: Sit start on two obvious edges in the middle of the cliff. This problem starts under the tallest part of the cliff. Go up until you are right under the lip, then traverse left a foot or two for an easy topout.

content.description: This is an overhanging boulder with a lot of weird, blocky holds. This has major potential for hard routes, potential for fun traverses, and a bunch of sloppy ledges for hard dyno problems. There is some choss, so be careful. Its back is to the trail and faces a stream. The landings aren’t terrible.
